result.execSummary:
The defendant Devon T Matter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA surcharge to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

records.addlTxt: Affidavit of Services for Court appointed counsel and billing statement, received and filed, by Attorney Clarice Perkins
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Devon T Matter in court with attorney Clarice Rosa Perkins.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting adjournment as she just received this matter and needs time to speak with her client. Court grants.  Hearing scheduled for April 6, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Devon T Matter in court.  Jayne Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is requesting the court to appoint counsel. Defendant is sworn. Court grants the request.  Defendant to pay $100.00 a month commencing 3/15/2015 and every month thereafter. Matter adjourned for the status of counsel  Hearing scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Devon T Matter in court.  Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation. Court grants the adjourns the matter for him to see the public defender.  Hearing scheduled for February 15, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

Defendant Devon T Matter in court.  Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.   Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for February 1, 2016 at 08:30 am.
